title: feat: add resource-scoped prompt file recommendations
body:
This PR enhances the `chat.promptFilesRecommendations` setting to support workspace folder-level configuration with proper inheritance hierarchy.

## Changes

- **Configuration scope**: Added `ConfigurationScope.RESOURCE` to enable folder-level settings
- **Context-aware recommendations**: Prompt suggestions now consider the active editor's workspace folder
- **Configuration merging**: Implemented proper inheritance (default → user → workspace → folder)

## Key Benefits

- Different projects can have tailored prompt recommendations
- Workspace folder settings override workspace/user settings appropriately  
- Maintains backward compatibility with existing global configurations
- Enables resource-aware when clauses (e.g., `resourceExtname == .js`) to work correctly

## Implementation

Follows established VS Code patterns:
- Uses `EditorResourceAccessor.getOriginalUri()` for resource context (consistent with 20+ other features)
- Leverages `configService.inspect()` with resource parameter for proper configuration inheritance
- Maintains type safety and robust error handling

The changes make the existing documentation for resource-aware when clauses fully functional.

title: Support AGENTS.md in parent and sub-folders

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: Request for new features or functionality

labels.name: chat-prompts
labels.description: Prompt and Instruction files related issues

body:
As initial support, VS Code recognizes AGENTS.md in the workspace root (https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/249387).

To be added:
- [ ] AGENTS.md in sub-folders, discovered on demand as the agent traverses files/folders
- [ ] 💪 AGENTS.md from parent directories (supports monorepo use cases), discovered automatically

Precedence order
- The scope of an AGENTS.md file is the entire directory tree rooted at the folder that contains it
- More-deeply-nested AGENTS.md files take precedence over those higher in the directory tree
- The closest AGENTS.md file wins in case of conflicting instructions

title: Linux desktop file: Add inode/directory support
body:
Adding `inode/directory` to the list of supported `MimeType`s allows VSCode to be shown (with priority placement) in the application list shown when a user right-clicks in (or on) a folder and chooses "Open With..."

At least in GNOME Nautilus, VSCode can be selected anyway (all applications are listed), but it's at the bottom of a potentially very long list. Adding the `MimeType` to the `code.desktop` file moves it up to the much shorter "Recommended Apps" list at the top.

title: Enable VS Code to auto-install extensions via policy and support auto-installation of MCP servers
body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

Request:
Enable VS Code to support policy-based auto-installation of extensions, including MCP servers.

Context:
This is part of a broader initiative to improve how copilots access enterprise knowledge. Auto-installing key MCP servers is a foundational step toward delivering more relevant, contextual answers.

Concern:
Installing too many extensions by default could impact developer experience—leading to slower startup times and unnecessary bloat.

Proposal:
There needs to be a way auto-install necessary servers and extensions as default. Teams internally should not be required to ask each organization owner to recommend these servers. There should be a central way to do this for all MSFT, not just recommend, but install. 
Idea?
Consider an orchestrated model where a central system dynamically calls remote MCP servers as needed, rather than installing all MCP Servers/extensions upfront. This would reduce overhead and ensure only relevant tools are surfaced when needed.

title: Validate MCP variable handling is correct

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

body:
Right now we don't handle all cases of input-able data properly, e.g.

- We don't deal with environment variables lacking a `value` (should lead to input)
- We take the `value_hint` as the value for positional args instead of letting the user configure it

We should create test cases for each of the example in https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/registry/blob/main/docs/reference/server-json/generic-server-json.md and validate they're handled correctly

title: MCP server configurations should be an options map

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: Request for new features or functionality

body:
Currently our approach to variables in installing servers is to generate the CLI and pop things out into Variables. However, I do not think this is the best approach because then it is impossible to safely update MCP servers as the command line may change between versions.

The design of the registry JSON/API is such that each parameter needed to form the command is named as input, which allows graceful changes between versions. It also lets users use standard `${}` variables in shared configs and is much more pleasant to deal with for servers with lots of config options. For example, instead of something like

```js
		"io.github.supabase-community/supabase-mcp": {
			"type": "stdio",
			"command": "npx",
			"args": [
				"-y",
				"--read-only",
				"--project-ref=${input:projectRef}",
				"@supabase-community/supabase-mcp@latest"
			],
			"gallery": "https://api.mcp.github.com/v0/servers/4149a06d-d2e5-464e-97fc-10d998da3810",
			"version": "0.0.1-seed"
		}
```

We should do

```js
		"io.github.supabase-community/supabase-mcp": {
			"config": {
				"projectRef": "${workspaceFolder}" // or it can be ${input:projectRef} if the user wants
			},
			"gallery": "https://api.mcp.github.com/v0/servers/4149a06d-d2e5-464e-97fc-10d998da3810",
			"version": "0.0.1-seed"
		}
```

The main exception is that password inputs _should_ always be variables. Otherwise I think we should just let the user make them variables afterwards if they want to (maybe have a quick action for it in the relevant JSON's.)

Unblocks https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-copilot/issues/15326

title: Remote SSH Session Chat Authentication (Login-in) Issues

labels.name: *duplicate
labels.description: Issue identified as a duplicate of another issue(s)

body: Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: N/A I'd like to follow up with the authentication issue (infinite login-ins). The issue persists despite trying different login methods. There is **no** problem with my local workspace, but only in my SSH workspace sessions. Trying newer versions of VS Code and the extension does not help. I've visited the meta issue: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/253132 , but the only resolved case does not apply to my situation (i.e., updating to newer versions of VS Code does not fix the issue). I'd appreciate any updates on this from the development team. Thanks! - VS Code Version: 1.103.2 (user setup) - Commit: 6f17636121051a53c88d3e605c491d22af2ba755 - Date: 2025-08-20T16:45:34.255Z - Electron: 37.2.3 - Node.js: 22.17.0 - Chromium: 138.0.7204.100 - OS: Windows_NT x64 10.0.19045 - OS Version (remote server): Ubuntu 22.04 (non-routable lab network with proxy `webproxy.ucsd.edu:3128`) - GitHub Copilot Chat Version: **0.30.3** - GitHub Copilot Extension Version: **1.368.0** - Remote type: **SSH** --- ## **Bug Summary** - Copilot Chat login works locally, but fails on remote servers (SSH workspaces) - In an SSH session: - The auth prompt launches normally, but since it's a remote session, the 127.0.0.1: page never responds. - Forwarding the port to local also doesn’t fix it. - No 127.0.0.1: server is ever observed running (lsof -i shows nothing). - If I cancel and retry, I’m directed to the login page again. - If I cancel once more, I’m offered the device code flow, which completes successfully ("You're all set!"). - If I cancel instead again, im directed to the device code flow option, where it ends with **completes successfully** ("...You're all set!") - Despite this, Copilot Chat remains stuck at the login screen. The lower right status shows Copilot as "ready", but it's neither available nor responsive in the chat tab. - Reloading the page after login does not help; the request-to-login cycle repeats. ## Logs and Diagnosis Examining the Copilot extension logs on the remote server shows the following repeated error: ``` ConnectTimeoutError: Connect Timeout Error (attempted address: api.github.com:443, timeout: 10000ms) GitHub Copilot could not connect to server. Extension activation failed: "fetch failed" ``` I do have SSH-over-proxy working for GitHub and also attempted the following configured proxy (`http_proxy`, `https_proxy`), but this does not resolve the issue. My take is that Copilot Chat's background agent might be not following configured proxy thus fails to reach GitHub. ## Proxy Setup (Required on our network) ```bash # In ~/.bashrc (for remote shell session) export http_proxy="http://webproxy.:3128" export https_proxy="http://webproxy.:3128" export NODE_OPTIONS="--proxy=http://webproxy.:3128" ``` ## Misc - Copilot Chat used to work on the same server, but failed to authenticate normally after an automatic log-out a few days ago. - No VPN was used during either the usage or reinstallation process.

title: `"editor.find.autoFindInSelection": "always"` shouldn't apply when selection is empty
body:
As opposed to `"multiline"`, the `"always"` option allows you to find in a selection that spans a single line; to me it's very useful when doing some kinds of find/replace sorcery. But if there's no selection at all, you can't find anything; in this case I don't think it's reasonable to keep enabling the "Find in Selection" toggle, as the whole Find feature becomes useless.

I considered opening a PR creating a new value for this setting, `"nonEmpty"`, but that shouldn't be necessary, as I don't see a use case for the current behavior. The only hypothetical scenario in which this could make sense is if you tried to select text _after_ opening the Find panel, but it doesn't work; you still can't find anything (which sounds a bit like a separate bug, I dunno).

I'm using an old version of VS Code (sorry for that, the newest version doesn't run on my system). I'm sorry if it's already fixed, tried looking through the closed issues but couldn't find anything relevant.

title: Double-click on punctuation selects adjacent space instead of the character
body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->

<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->

Double-clicking non-letter characters selects the neighboring space instead of the character itself. See attached screencast.

Sample text:

```
// a b c 1 2 3 ~ ! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + \ /
// aa AA // ← double-click the first character of these pairs
```

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Paste the sample lines above.
2. Double-click on a symbol like `@`, `#`, `!`, `\`, or `/`.
3. Also try the first `/` in `//`.

Expected:
The clicked character (or token, e.g. `//`) is selected.

Actual:
The adjacent space is selected; the symbol itself is not. For `//`, double-clicking the first `/` selects the space next to it, while double-clicking the second `/` selects `//` as expected.

Please see the screencast to better understand what is happening.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0c8658b5-fcf5-42e2-b93c-30080a8f94b1

title: runTests can't find tests in a file
body:
The runTests tool cannot find any tests in my E2E tests file (e2e.py), even though it does have many tests. It might be because I named it "e2e.py" instead of "e2e_test.py" or "test_e2e.py", the standard pytest test discovery naming. That's intentional, as I always run it separately from the fast pytest tests.

Here's the file:
https://github.com/Azure-Samples/azure-search-openai-demo/blob/main/tests/e2e.py

GitHub Copilot logs are below.


Version: 1.104.0-insider (Universal)
Commit: e296bdfe0313d571a6f58399b22afd199f6da454
Date: 2025-09-08T05:26:36.685Z
Electron: 37.3.1
ElectronBuildId: 12259562
Chromium: 138.0.7204.235
Node.js: 22.18.0
V8: 13.8.258.31-electron.0
OS: Darwin arm64 23.6.0

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open https://github.com/Azure-Samples/azure-search-openai-demo/
2. Use "fixer" mode in GitHub Copilot
3. Ask it to run the E2E playwright tests


# Tool Call - call_IU2uqaWgR9kLS0x409vkP0n3__vscode-1757360813940

## Request
~~~
id   : call_IU2uqaWgR9kLS0x409vkP0n3__vscode-1757360813940
tool : runTests
args : {
  "files": [
    "/Users/pamelafox/azure-search-openai-demo/tests/e2e.py"

No tests found in the files. Ensure the correct absolute paths are passed to the tool.

title: Chat: Invalid/failed tool calls are never shown to the user

When chat would show the error, it would clearly be seen as the agent self-healing its mistakes, and build trust. Most other tools do show failed tool calls; it just needs to be done consistently. title: Add PR number to chat panel PR card title for easier identification
body:
When using the `#activePullRequest` variable in chat, the PR card that appears in the chat panel displays only the title and author, making it difficult to confirm which PR is being referenced. This is especially confusing when multiple PRs are open, as users need to cross-reference with the status bar to verify the correct PR number.

**Before:**
```
[WIP] Expanding Jupyter Notebook with Additional Cells - bamurtaugh
```

**After:**
```
#71 [WIP] Expanding Jupyter Notebook with Additional Cells - bamurtaugh
```

This change prepends the `linkTag` property (which contains the PR number like "#71") to the existing title format in the chat PR card. The `linkTag` data was already available in the `IChatPullRequestContent` interface but wasn't being displayed.

**Benefits:**
- Users can instantly verify they're looking at the correct PR without checking the status bar
- Reduces confusion when working with multiple open PRs
- Maintains consistency with how PR numbers are displayed elsewhere in VS Code
- Minimal change with no breaking functionality

The implementation modifies a single line in `ChatPullRequestContentPart` to include the PR number in the card title display.

Fixes #266052.

title: codebase issue

labels.name: info-needed
labels.description: Issue requires more information from poster

body:
Copilot Chat Extension Version: [your version]
VS Code Version: [your version]
OS Version: [your OS]
Feature(s) Affected: Ask, Edit, and Agent modes
Selected Model(s): GPT-4, Claude 4 Sonnet, others tested

⸻

Description

When using GitHub Copilot Chat in VS Code, even after providing a codebase, the extension still repeatedly prompts with:

“Attach a codebase to make changes”

This happens consistently across all modes (Ask, Edit, Agent) and with all models. The issue makes it impossible to utilize codebase-specific editing or answering, since Copilot does not detect that the codebase has already been attached.

⸻

Steps to Reproduce
	1.	Open a project in VS Code.
	2.	Attach the codebase in Copilot Chat.
	3.	Ask Copilot to make edits or analyze code.
	4.	Observe that it still says “Attach codebase to do changes” despite the codebase being provided.

⸻

Expected Behavior

Copilot Chat should recognize the attached codebase and allow editing, analysis, and Q&A without repeatedly asking to attach it again.

⸻

Actual Behavior

Copilot ignores the attached codebase and continues to prompt for attaching it, preventing edits or meaningful responses.

title: Enable middle mouse button to open links and go to definition

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: Request for new features or functionality

labels.name: editor-core
labels.description: Editor basic functionality

labels.name: insiders-released
labels.description: Patch has been released in VS Code Insiders

body:
(see https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/pull/154465 and https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/3130)

Verification steps:
Set:
```json
"editor.mouseMiddleClickAction": "ctrlLeftClick",
```
... check that in the editor whenever you use the middle mouse button to click on text, that behaves as if you used ctrl+left click.

Set:
```json
"editor.mouseMiddleClickAction": "openLink",
```
... check that when you use the middle mouse button to click on a link, that link opens (otherwise middle mouse click has default behavior, i.e. nothing should happen).

title: Introduces editor.mouseMiddleClickAction: default|openLink|ctrlLeftClick

Closes https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/266045
Replaces https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/pull/154465

```json
"editor.mouseMiddleClickAction": "ctrlLeftClick",
```

```json
"editor.mouseMiddleClickAction": "openLink",
```

title: Incompetent copilot

labels.name: info-needed
labels.description: Issue requires more information from poster

body:
Type: Bug Thank you for your feedback. For Azure Functions on Flex Consumption, the metric namespace for metric alerts remains "Microsoft.Web/sites", and the metric name for execution count is still "FunctionExecutionCount". There is currently no official documentation from Microsoft stating a change to "Microsoft.Web/sites/flexConsumption" or "FlexConsumptionFunctionExecutionCount". The only required change for metric alerts when moving to Flex Consumption is to ensure the scopes property references the correct function app resources. The metric namespace and metric name do not change. References: Microsoft Docs: Monitor Azure Functions metrics Microsoft Docs: Supported metrics for Azure Functions If you have specific documentation or requirements that indicate otherwise, please share the link or details. Otherwise, your metric alerts for Flex Consumption should continue to use: "metricNamespace": "Microsoft.Web/sites" "metricName": "FunctionExecutionCount" No changes to metricNamespace or metricName are required for Flex Consumption at this time. You have lost credibility and all your suggested changes are now unusable. Understood. Thank you for your direct feedback. If you would like to proceed, please specify the exact changes or documentation you want applied, and I will follow your instructions precisely. title: Change encoding of document while it is beeing opened

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: Request for new features or functionality

labels.name: file-encoding
labels.description: File encoding type issues

milestone.title: Backlog Candidates
milestone.description: Work that is not yet accepted for the Backlog. We wait for the community to weigh in.

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/824 Added apis to re-open documents with the "correct" encoding. This works fine for "normal" operation.

However, during a search and replace in documents which are not currently open (for example), the editor triggers "onDidOpenTextDocument" followed by "onWillSaveTextDocument", and it seems like there is no way to fix the encoding. I can re-open the document during onDidOpenTextDocument using vscode.workspace.openTextDocument, but the document in onWillSaveTextDocument has the original, wrong encoding, and since the document is dirty i cannot re-re-open it. And i believe during onDidSaveTextDocument im too late already

Would it be possible to add a way to change the encoding of a document which is about to be loaded? Or how could i go about this problem?

labels.name: terminal-shell-zsh

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
I noticed Copilot had a hard time reading output of commands it ran in the terminal. @Tyriar helped me narrow this down to the fact that used [Spaceship](https://spaceship-prompt.sh/) as a shell extension.

My config:

```
SPACESHIP_PROMPT_ASYNC=true
SPACESHIP_PROMPT_SEPARATE_LINE=false
SPACESHIP_PROMPT_ADD_NEWLINE=false
SPACESHIP_PROMPT_ORDER=(
    time
    user
    dir
    git
    char
)
source /opt/homebrew/opt/spaceship/spaceship.zsh
```

title: VS Code 1.103.2 crashes with EXC_BREAKPOINT (SIGTRAP) in Electron's c-ares DNS library on macOS 15.6.1 (Sequoia)

labels.name: info-needed
labels.description: Issue requires more information from poster

labels.name: freeze-slow-crash-leak
labels.description: VS Code crashing, performance, freeze and memory leak issues

labels.name: under-discussion
labels.description: Issue is under discussion for relevance, priority, approach

body:
**VS Code Version:** 1.103.2

**OS Version:** macOS 15.6.1 (24G90), Apple M2 MacBook Air (8 GB RAM)

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Launch VS Code normally.
2. Perform routine tasks (e.g., [describe what you were doing at the time, if known—editing files, using extensions, network operations like Git pull, or after wake from sleep]).
3. Crash occurs unexpectedly on the main thread.

**Expected Behavior:**
VS Code should remain stable without crashing.

**Actual Behavior:**
VS Code crashes with a breakpoint exception in the Electron Framework, specifically in c-ares (DNS resolution library). No specific user action triggered it visibly, but it happened ~16 minutes after waking the Mac from sleep (Time Since Wake: 965 seconds).

**Crash Log:**
Attached as `vscode_crash_2025-09-10.txt` (full report below for reference).

**Relevant Stack Trace (Crashed Thread 0 - CrBrowserMain):**
- Exception Type: EXC_BREAKPOINT (SIGTRAP)
- Termination Reason: Namespace SIGNAL, Code 5 Trace/BPT trap: 5
- Key Frames:
  0. Electron Framework: ares_llist_node_first + 3553388 (repeated calls suggesting linked list corruption in DNS handling)
  1. Electron Framework: node::sqlite::UserDefinedFunction::xDestroy(void*) + 27600
  2. Electron Framework: v8::PropertyDescriptor::set() const + 4297956 (V8 JS engine involvement)
  3. ... (propagates through UV event loop: uv__io_poll, CFRunLoop, AppKit event handling)
  4. Leads to main Electron entry: ElectronMain + 124

Full translated report and JSON details are in the attached file. The crash involves networking/DNS (c-ares), V8 garbage collection, and the main event loop. No extensions or child processes directly implicated, but could be related to post-sleep network state or low-memory pressure.

**Screenshots:** (Optional—add if relevant, e.g., crash dialog)

**Additional Context:**
- Time Awake Since Boot: 230000 seconds (~2.6 days uptime).
- No external modifications or disallowed activities (SIP enabled).
- Similar crashes reported in Electron/Node.js on macOS Sequoia due to DNS resolution bugs after sleep/wake or network changes.
- Tested: [Mention if you've tried updating, disabling extensions, etc.]
- Extensions installed: [List if relevant, e.g., via `code --list-extensions` output].

**Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?** Yes/No (test with `code --disable-extensions`)

**Does this issue occur when using VS Code Insiders?** (Optional)

Please let me know if more info is needed!

[Crashed Report.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22254385/Crashed.Report.txt)
